content: ombre blossom cowl the ombre blossom cowl allows your colorful or ombre yarn to bloom make a complete cowl with approximately 200 yards of dk or worsted yarn the cowl is crocheted in the round and from the bottom up the last row is the top edging row then you will go back to the bottom edge your starting chain edge and add another row of edging and you are finished the simple picot edging gives the edges a wavy look this is a basic granny pattern but it forms diagonals because the 3 double_crochet offset cluster is crocheted in the 1st stitch of each cluster instead of between clusters as is done in a traditional granny stitch pattern i call them 3 double_crochet offset clusters the blossom cowl pictured is crocheted with plymouth yarn kudo in #55 other suggested yarns are knit picks chroma worsted cascade souk malabrigo rios or arroyo madelinetosh dk and noro dk or worsted yarns stitch of the row or you can substitute a chain 3 for sdc if you abbreviations prefer that double_crochet stitch* sdc the sdc will be the first getting started yarn approximately 200 yards of worsted or dk weight yarn dimensions finished cowl will be approximately 12 inches wide and 9 25 inches tall crochet hook size h8/5 00 mm darning needle for sewing in loose ends gauge 4 stitches per inch depending on yarn and your gauge and gauge size this pattern is written for one size to adjust the pattern to make it wider add on multiples of 3 or to narrow subtract multiples of 3 to make the cowl taller add on additional rounds of row 2 start crocheting the ombre blossom cowl is crocheted in the round you will do an fsc or starting chain and one round of single_crochet then 16 rounds of the 3 double_crochet offset cluster then another row of single_crochet after the single_crochet row you ll do the picot edging on the top of the cowl join yarn on the bottom edge and add a picot edging row you will have 26 3 offset double_crochet clusters per round and 78 stitches per row chain 78 and join in the round with a slip_stitch being careful not to twist your starting chain and start with row 1 or fsc 78 stitches and join in the round and then skip row 1 and proceed
